intro: Nototriche tucumana, commonly known as the Tucumán nototriche, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, adapting to the arid environments it inhabits. Nototriche tucumana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
